bioghist.p: John Capnerhurst Hall was the nephew of John Hall. Hall adopted the boy and paid for his education in England, in return for which he took Hall's name and dropped his original surname. He worked for Boulton and Fothergill near Birmingham as a sort of trouble shooter for the steam engines the firm licensed, installed, and repaired. He emigrated to the United States in 1783 (before his uncle) and set up a foundry at Mount Hope, New Jersey.

scopecontent.p: This is a journal of John Capnerhurst Hall kept between 1777 and 1779. The volume includes notes on his mechanical work, drawings of equipment, and chemical tables and mathematical formulae, as well as descriptions of conversations, excursions, and other events. The journal includes an index to entries.
